e658b17c-01eb-4282-b0d5-2291ac3578dd.description: Earners of the Attendee Badge participated in the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS) at Bossier Parish Community College in Louisiana. The outcomes of 3CS leverage community college cybersecurity programs across the nation by introducing the latest technologies, best practices, curricula, products, and more. Badge earners attended at least 3 Sessions and submitted feedback to 3CS, which is the only national academic conference focused on cybersecurity education at community colleges.
e658b17c-01eb-4282-b0d5-2291ac3578dd.name: Community College Cyber Summit (3CS) Attendee

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework: Oversee and Govern
alignments.description: Training, Education, and Awareness: Conducts training of personnel within pertinent subject domain. Develops, plans, coordinates, delivers and/or evaluates training courses, methods, and techniques as appropriate.

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit -"Change is Now".
Attend at least 3 Sessions and complete 3 Feedback Forms.
Complete and submit the overall Survey Form.
Submit a "Quotable Quote" post conference.

f1abfe5c-e6a5-468d-8ec6-bafcf1965cba.description: This badge holder has demonstrated their knowledge and expertise as a Speaker who has presented to a large group at the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS). As a presenter, they have been recognized for the understanding of their subject area and for contributing to cybersecurity education for community colleges. The outcomes of 3CS leverage community college cybersecurity programs across the nation by introducing the latest technologies, best practices, curricula, products, and more.
f1abfe5c-e6a5-468d-8ec6-bafcf1965cba.name: Community College Cyber Summit (3CS) Presenter

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework
alignments.description: Skill units as defined in the NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework are listed in the criteria above.

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a relevant topic and be selected to present by the 3CS Proposal Review Committee.

Successfully present area of expertise to attendees that include: IT Faculty, College Administrators, Cybersecurity students, Employers, Colleges, Government Officials, and Business & Industry Representatives.
Submit presentation materials (slide deck, handouts).
Complete and submit feedback form.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0070: Skill in talking to others to convey information effectively

7a0aafbf-33cd-4f3c-91b0-898b66bbf2d4.description: Earners of the Cybersecurity Skills Development Workshop Hands-On Cryptography badge have demonstrated fundamental knowledge and hands-on application of both classical and modern cryptographic techniques; common implementations in hardware and software; and common attacks. This badge is issued by CyberWatch, Inc. and the workshop is taught by Casey W. O’Brien, Executive Director & Principal Investigator, National CyberWatch Center.
7a0aafbf-33cd-4f3c-91b0-898b66bbf2d4.name: CyberWatch Hands-On Cryptography Workshop Certificate

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework
alignments.description: Knowledge and Skill units as defined in the NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework are listed in the criteria above.

alignments.name: NSA Center of Academic Excellence - Cyber Defense
alignments.description: This course aligns with the NSA CAE-CD KU's Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Operating Systems Concepts (OSC), Basic Cryptography (BCY), Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Basic Scripting and Programming (BSP)

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Hands-On Cryptography Workshop at the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS).
Attend the 8 hour Workshop for Hands-On Cryptography.
Participate in the course lectures and hands on exercises.
Knowledge of the following prerequisites: IT Literacy, Concepts, and Terminology; Software; Scripting; Virtualization; Information Security.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0089 - Skill in one-way hash functions (e.g., Secure Hash Algorithm [SHA], Message Digest Algorithm [MD5]).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0138 - Skill in using Public-Key Infrastructure (PKI) encryption and digital signature capabilities into applications (e.g., S/MIME email, SSL traffic).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0007 - Knowledge of authentication, authorization, and access control methods.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0018 - Knowledge of encryption algorithms
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0019 - Knowledge of cryptography and cryptographic key management concepts
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0190 - Knowledge of encryption methodologies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0285 - Knowledge of implementing enterprise key escrow systems to support data-at-rest encryption.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0305 - Knowledge of encryption algorithms, stenography, and other forms of data concealment.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0308 - Knowledge of cryptology.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0427 - Knowledge of encryption algorithms and cyber capabilities/tools (e.g., SSL, PGP).
NSA CAE-CD - Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF) - Access Control, Authentication, Benefits of Cryptography, Block Cipher, Confidentiality, Stream Cipher.
NSA CAE-CD KU - Basic Scripting and Programming (BSP) - Boolean Math, OR, XOR

NSA CAE-CD KU - Basic Cryptography (BCY) - Algorithms (cryptographic, decryption, encryption, hashing, secure hash, asymmetric, symmetric), Cryptography (asymmetric, aymmetric, classical, and Public Key), Collision, Cryptanalysis, Cryptosystem, Digital Signatures, Hash Functions, Integrity, Keys (escrow, management, pair, private, public, PKI, session, shared), Nonrepudiation, PRNG, Randomness
NSA CAE-CD KU - Operating Systems Concepts (OSC) - Access Control

1cde767d-72b0-4f43-b5e6-dd19f2c78ab7.description: Earners of the 3CS IBM QRadar Workshop Certificate have been provided a high level look at IBM QRadar; understand fundamentals of security intelligence and event management; and the value of teaching hands-on SIEM skills to their students. Earners know resources to explore incorporating IBM QRadar into their classes; and gained a clear understanding of how and where to access IBM resources that may be used at no charge for learning and teaching, as well as for conducting non-commercial research.
1cde767d-72b0-4f43-b5e6-dd19f2c78ab7.name: 3CS IBM QRadar Workshop Certificate

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework
alignments.description: Knowledge and Skill units as defined in the NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework are listed in the criteria above.

alignments.name: NSA Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense
alignments.description: This course aligns with the NSA CAE-CD KU's Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Operating Systems Concepts (OSC), Basic Cryptography (BCY), Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Basic Scripting and Programming (BSP)

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the IBM QRadar Workshop at the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS) and create an IBM account to complete hands on exercises.
Attend the 1 day workshop for IBM QRadar.
Participate in the course lectures and hands on exercises.
Knowledge of the following prerequisites: An understanding of, or experience in the following topics: IT Infrastructure and IT Security Fundamentals; TCP/IP Networking; Log Management; Linux/Windows.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0340 - Skill to monitor target or threat situation and environmental factors.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0343 - Skill to orchestrate intelligence planning teams, coordinate collection and production support, and monitor status.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0347 - Skill to review performance specifications and historical information about collection assets.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0353 - Skill to use systems and/or tools to track collection requirements and determine if they are satisfied.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0370 - Skill to use cyber defense Service Provider reporting structure and processes within one’s own organization.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0034 - Knowledge of network services and protocols interactions that provide network communications.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0180 - Knowledge of network systems management principles, models, methods (e.g., end-to-end systems performance monitoring), and tools.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0255 - Knowledge of network architecture concepts including topology, protocols, and components.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0272 - Knowledge of network analysis tools used to identify software communications vulnerabilities.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0332 - Knowledge of network protocols such as TCP/IP, Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory services.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0481 - Knowledge of methods and techniques used to detect various exploitation activities.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0483 - Knowledge of methods to integrate and summarize information from any potential sources.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0487 - Knowledge of network security (e.g., encryption, firewalls, authentication, honey pots, perimeter protection).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0488 - Knowledge of network security implementations (e.g., host-based IDS, IPS, access control lists), including their function and placement in a network.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework -A0001- Ability to identify systemic security issues based on the analysis of vulnerability and configuration data.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework -A0005 - Ability to decrypt digital data collections.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0015 - Ability to conduct vulnerability scans and recognize vulnerabilities in security systems.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0062 - Ability to monitor measures or indicators of system performance and availability.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0065 - Ability to monitor traffic flows across the network.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0066 - Ability to accurately and completely source all data used in intelligence, assessment and/or planning products.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0076 - Ability to coordinate and collaborate with analysts regarding surveillance requirements and essential information development.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0119 - Ability to understand the basic concepts and issues related to cyber and its organizational impact.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0120 - Ability to share meaningful insights about the context of an organization’s threat environment that improve its risk management posture.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0123 - Ability to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0128 - Ability to apply techniques for detecting host and network-based intrusions using intrusion detection technologies.

813955c6-204a-4f4c-a7c6-b662202820d0.description: Earners of the Volunteer Badge volunteered at the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS) at Bossier Parish Community College in Louisiana. The outcomes of 3CS leverage community college cybersecurity programs across the nation by introducing the latest technologies, best practices, curricula, products, and more.
813955c6-204a-4f4c-a7c6-b662202820d0.name: Community College Cyber Summit (3CS) Volunteer

badge_template_activities.title: Volunteer to assist with the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS) at Bossier Parish Community College in Louisiana.
Provide a minimum of 5 hours of volunteer work for the conference.

d43fb34a-67d2-45f8-a17f-39f4860a8f2c.description: Earners of the CyberWatch Secure Scripting Workshop Certificate have completed professional development on basic concepts and advanced techniques in secure scripting using a set of curriculum materials developed by the NSF-funded C5 project. The materials align with learning outcomes in the NSA CAE "Basic Scripting and Programming" knowledge unit.
d43fb34a-67d2-45f8-a17f-39f4860a8f2c.name: CyberWatch Secure Scripting Workshop Certificate

alignments.name: The National Security Agency (NSA) Centers of Academic Excellence (CAE)
alignments.description: This course aligns with the NSA CAE-CD KU's: Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Cybersecurity Principles (CSP), Basic Cryptography (BCY), Basic Scripting and Programming (BSP), Operating Systems Concepts (OSC), Secure Programming Practices (SPP)

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework
alignments.description: Knowledge and Skill units as defined in the NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework are listed in the criteria above.

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Secure Scripting Workshop  at the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS)
Attend the 1 day workshop for Secure Scripting
Participate in the course lectures and hands-on learning activities that includes: secure scripting in BASH and Python languages, as well as Linux basics.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0001 - Skill in conducting vulnerability scans and recognizing vulnerabilities in security systems.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0014 - Skill in conducting software debugging.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0019 - Skill in creating programs that validate and process multiple inputs including command line arguments, environmental variables, and input streams.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0021- Skill in designing a data analysis structure (i.e., the types of data a test must generate and how to analyze that data).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0031 - Skill in developing and applying security system access controls.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0061- Skill in writing test plans.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0067 - Skill in identifying, modifying, and manipulating applicable system components within Windows, Unix, or Linux (e.g., passwords, user accounts, files).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0089 - Skill in one-way hash functions (e.g., Secure Hash Algorithm [SHA], Message Digest Algorithm [MD5]).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0100 - Skill in utilizing or developing learning activities (e.g., scenarios, instructional games, interactive exercises).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0107 - Skill in designing and documenting overall program Test & Evaluation strategies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0149 - Skill in developing applications that can log and handle errors, exceptions, and application faults and logging.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0270 - Skill in reverse engineering (e.g., hex editing, binary packaging utilities, debugging, and strings analysis) to identify function and ownership of remote tools.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0367 - Skill to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0005 - Knowledge of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0007 - Knowledge of authentication, authorization, and access control methods.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0014 - Knowledge of complex data structures.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0015 - Knowledge of computer algorithms.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0016 - Knowledge of computer programming principles.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0068 - Knowledge of programming language structures and logic.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0070 - Knowledge of system and application security threats and vulnerabilities
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0082 - Knowledge of software engineering.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0139 - Knowledge of interpreted and compiled computer languages.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0152 - Knowledge of software related information technology (IT) security principles and methods (e.g., modularization, layering, abstraction, data hiding, simplicity/minimization).

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0189 - Knowledge of malware with virtual machine detection (e.g. virtual aware malware, debugger aware malware, and unpacked malware that looks for VM-related strings in your computer’s display device).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0224 - Knowledge of system administration concepts for operating systems such as but not limited to Unix/Linux, IOS, Android, and Windows operating systems.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0263 - Knowledge of information technology (IT) risk management policies, requirements, and procedures.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0305 - Knowledge of encryption algorithms, stenography, and other forms of data concealment.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0325 - Knowledge of Information Theory (e.g., source coding, channel coding, algorithm complexity theory, and data compression).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0342 - Knowledge of penetration testing principles, tools, and techniques.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0372 - Knowledge of programming concepts (e.g., levels, structures, compiled vs. interpreted languages).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0396 - Knowledge of computer programming concepts, including computer languages, programming, testing, debugging, and file types.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0418 - Knowledge of data flow process for terminal or environment collection.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0529 - Knowledge of scripting
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0557 - Knowledge of terminal or environmental collection (process, objectives, organization, targets, etc.).

NSA CAE-CD - Basic Scripting and Programming (BSP) - Basic Boolean logic/operations; implement basic security concepts including: permissions, type checking, input validation, parameter validation; understand basic data structures and algorithms; scripting on both Windows and Linux.

NSA CAE-CD - Basic Scripting and Programming (BSP)-Properly apply basic programming constructs and concepts including: Variables and types, strings, Sequential and parallel execution, decisions and branching, loops, functions, debugging techniques. Be familiar with the concept and basic implementation of regular expressions.
NSA CAE-CD - Basic Cryptography (BCY) - basic ability to understand where and how cryptography is used

NSA CAE-CD- Cybersecurity Foundation (CSF) - provide students with a basic understanding of the fundamental concepts behind cybersecurity including cryptographic Hash functions, file attributes, and modes permissions, Linux.
NSA CAE-CD - Operating Systems Concepts (OSC) - provide students with an understanding of the roles of operating system Linux, its basic functions, and the services provided by the operating system.

0379ca09-8743-4eff-8edb-2d9a35827754.description: Earners of the CyberWatch Cybersecurity Skills Journal (CSJ): Paper Development Workshop Certificate understand the actionable steps they should take to make their research more relevant for cybersecurity practitioners, instructors, and/or researchers. Earners have the knowledge of how to improve the quality of cybersecurity research, to help develop and disseminate effective practices, and to bring practitioners and scholars into the conversation around skilled performance in cybersecurity.
0379ca09-8743-4eff-8edb-2d9a35827754.name: CyberWatch Cybersecurity Skills Journal (CSJ): Paper Development Workshop Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Cybersecurity Skills Journal (CSJ): Paper Development Workshop at the 2019 Community College Cyber Summit (3CS)
Attend the 1 day workshop for Cybersecurity Skills Journal (CSJ): Paper Development Workshop
Upload (1) concept abstract (max. 500 words); (2) paper proposal (max. 4000 words); or (3) full papers (max. 15,000 words) through the Cybersecurity Skills Journal Manuscript Submission System
